name: Data Analysis
description: A dictionary with data analysis terms

terms.name: Data Cleaning
terms.description: The process of identifying and correcting errors or inconsistencies in datasets

terms.name: Data Exploration
terms.description: The initial phase of data analysis focused on understanding the main characteristics of a dataset

terms.name: Data Visualization
terms.description: The representation of data in graphical or visual formats to facilitate understanding and insights

terms.name: Descriptive Statistics
terms.description: Methods of summarizing and presenting data to describe its main features

terms.name: Inferential Statistics
terms.description: Methods of drawing inferences about a population based on a sample of data

terms.name: Hypothesis Testing
terms.description: A statistical method used to make inferences about a population based on a sample of data

terms.name: Regression Analysis
terms.description: A statistical method for modeling the relationship between a dependent variable and one or more independent variables

terms.name: Machine Learning
terms.description: A field of artificial intelligence that focuses on developing algorithms allowing computers to learn patterns and make predictions from data

terms.name: Clustering
terms.description: A technique in data analysis used to group similar data points together

terms.name: Classification
terms.description: A machine learning task where the goal is to assign a label or category to input data

terms.name: Feature Engineering
terms.description: The process of creating new features from existing ones to improve machine learning model performance

terms.name: Dimensionality Reduction
terms.description: The process of reducing the number of features in a dataset to simplify analysis and improve model efficiency

terms.name: Outlier Detection
terms.description: Identification of data points that deviate significantly from the majority of the dataset

terms.name: Time Series Analysis
terms.description: A technique for analyzing time-ordered data points to uncover patterns, trends, and seasonality

terms.name: Correlation
terms.description: A statistical measure indicating the extent to which two variables change together

terms.name: ANOVA (Analysis of Variance)
terms.description: A statistical method used to analyze the differences among group means in a sample

terms.name: A/B Testing
terms.description: An experimentation method in which two versions (A and B) are compared to determine which performs better

terms.name: Data Mining
terms.description: The process of discovering patterns and knowledge from large amounts of data

terms.name: Big Data
terms.description: Refers to extremely large and complex datasets that traditional data processing applications may not handle efficiently

terms.name: Cross-Validation
terms.description: A technique to assess how well a predictive model generalizes to an independent dataset

terms.name: ANOVA (Analysis of Variance)
terms.description: A statistical method used to analyze the differences among group means in a sample

terms.name: Data Warehouse
terms.description: A large, centralized repository of data gathered from multiple sources to support business intelligence and reporting

terms.name: Random Forest
terms.description: An ensemble learning method that operates by constructing a multitude of decision trees during training

terms.name: Feature Importance
terms.description: A measure of the contribution of each feature to the performance of a machine learning model

terms.name: Confusion Matrix
terms.description: A table used to evaluate the performance of a classification algorithm, showing the counts of true positive, true negative, false positive, and false negative predictions

terms.name: Data Preprocessing
terms.description: The preparation and cleaning of raw data to make it suitable for analysis and machine learning

terms.name: K-Means Clustering
terms.description: A popular algorithm in data analysis for partitioning a dataset into K distinct, non-overlapping subsets

terms.name: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
terms.description: A field of artificial intelligence focused on enabling computers to understand, interpret, and generate human language

terms.name: Time Series Forecasting
terms.description: The process of predicting future values based on past observations in time-ordered data
